32.title: "A Picture of Geronimo"
32.author: by Fred Harman
32.appears_in: 12 p. in Red Ryder Comics, no. 128 (Mar. 1954).
notes: Begins: "Wake-um up, Little Beaver! We go to Rimrock today for Grandma Snap Turtle! Buy pretty calico for dress she make me!"

Summary: Little Beaver and Po-Ko are planning to show Mr. Baker, a photographer, where the Navajos live, but renegade Apaches have driven them into hiding. The Apaches capture Baker and the children. Using the camera and some flash powder, the kids manage to free themselves and in the process get a picture of Geronimo, that will be published in Mr. Baker's book.

138.title: Picture This
138.author: by Lynda Barry ; with guest water colorist Kevin Kawula.
notes: Other titles: Near-Sighted Monkey Book ; Learn How to Art with the Near-Sighted Monkey.

Summary (from SkyRiver): A series of portraits features a myopic monkey protagonist and the author's most beloved character, Marlys, in a collection that follows her everyday and fantastical routines of preparing food, waiting for the bus, and associating with her elephant-eared imaginary friend.

145.author: Virginia & George.
notes: Summary: He broke the stereo, a vase, and the TV, tore the drapes, tarred the rug, and his ball went through the picture window. Mom squirts him in the face.

150.title: Picturebook : Directory of Children's Illustration.

notes: "Especially designed for editors, publishers, book packagers and art directors, Picturebook connects the publishing world with great children's book artists!"

151.heading: PictureBox Inc.
151.title: BJ & Da Dogs
151.author: Ben Jones
notes: "Drawings : Ben Jones, Jacob & Jessica Ciocci, Beau LaBute."

Summary (from publisher's website via SkyRiver): "Half art book, half graphic novel, this tome intersperses photographs, drawings, prints, and junk by Paper Rad with two graphic novellas (Spaceballz and Alfe) by Ben Jones. The best account of the Paper Rad magic."

152.heading: PictureBox Inc.
152.title: City-Hunter Magazine.
152.author: [No author]
notes: Summary: Providence-based artist, C.F.'s latest zine is a fusion of comics, painting, photography, abstract imagery, prose and "advertisements." These disparate elements are loosely connected by the exploration of urban tropes from genre fiction. The protagonist of sorts, Main Dice, interacts with these environments and their inhabitants, but is only shown from a distance, adding further prominence and mystique to these settings.
Expanded version of a zine originally issued by the author's Fantasy Empire Magazine Co.

153.heading: PictureBox Inc.
153.title: De Profundis
153.author: James Jarvis.
notes: "James Jarvis' debut graphic novel, De Profundis, follows an artist who travels through a wilderness to arrive at an abandoned city. Wandering the empty streets he encounters a mysterious, priestly being who commissions him to decorate a temple to nameless gods."

159.heading: PictureBox Inc.
159.title: If 'n Oof
159.author: Brian Chippendale.
notes: Summary (from publisher via SkyRiver): "If and Oof are a Laurel and Hardy-esque duo who suffer a series of misadventures amidst Chippendale's frenetic landscapes on their simple quest to just survive, eat, pay rent and avoid confrontation. Comedy and horror ensue in this fast-paced trip through Chippendale's unconscious. The artist's most accessible work to date, If 'n Oof is replete with the frenzied line work and concise, witty dialogue for which he has become known."
